org.locationtech.geowave.core.store.statistics

Interface DataStatisticsStore

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DataStatisticsStoreImpl

    public interface DataStatisticsStore
    This is responsible for persisting data statistics (either in memory or to disk depending on the implementation).

    • Method Summary

      • getFieldStatistics

        CloseableIterator<? extends FieldStatistic<? extends StatisticValue<?>>> getFieldStatistics(DataTypeAdapter<?> type,
                                                                                            @Nullable
                                                                                            StatisticType<? extends StatisticValue<?>> statisticType,
                                                                                            @Nullable
                                                                                            String fieldName,
                                                                                            @Nullable
                                                                                            String tag)
        Get all field statistics for the given type. If a field name is specified, only statistics that pertain to that field will be returned.
        Parameters:
        type - the type to get statistics for
        statisticType - an optional statistic type filter
        fieldName - an optional field name filter
        tag - an optional tag filter
        Returns:
        a list of field statistics for the given type

      • getStatisticById

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> Statistic<V> getStatisticById(StatisticId<V> statisticId)
        Gets the statistic with the given StatisticId, or null if it could not be found.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the statistic that matched the given ID

      • setStatisticValue

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> void setStatisticValue(Statistic<V> statistic,
                                                       V value)
        This will write the statistic value to the underlying store. Note that this will overwrite whatever the current persisted values are for the given statistic. Use incorporateStatistic to aggregate the statistic value with any existing values. This method is not applicable to statistics that use a binning strategy.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic that the value belongs to
        value - the value to set

      • setStatisticValue

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> void setStatisticValue(Statistic<V> statistic,
                                                       V value,
                                                       ByteArray bin)
        This will write the statistic value to the underlying store. Note that this will overwrite whatever the current persisted values are for the given statistic. Use incorporateStatistic to aggregate the statistic value with any existing values. This method is not applicable to statistics that do not use a binning strategy.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic that the value belongs to
        value - the value to set
        bin - the bin that the value belongs to

      • incorporateStatisticValue

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> void incorporateStatisticValue(Statistic<V> statistic,
                                                               V value)
        Add the statistic value to the store, preserving the existing value. This method is not applicable to statistics that use a binning strategy.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to that the value belongs to
        value - the value to add

      • incorporateStatisticValue

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> void incorporateStatisticValue(Statistic<V> statistic,
                                                               V value,
                                                               ByteArray bin)
        Add the statistic value to the store, preserving the existing value. This method is not applicable to statistics that do not use a binning strategy.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to that the value belongs to
        value - the value to add
        bin - the bin that the value belongs to

      • removeStatisticValue

        boolean removeStatisticValue(Statistic<? extends StatisticValue<?>> statistic)
        Removes the value of the given statistic. This method is not applicable to statistics that use a binning strategy.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to remove the value for
        Returns:
        true if the value was removed

      • removeStatisticValue

        boolean removeStatisticValue(Statistic<? extends StatisticValue<?>> statistic,
                             ByteArray bin)
        Removes the value of the given statistic. This method is not applicable to statistics that do not use a binning strategy.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to remove the value for
        bin - the bin of the statistic value to remove
        Returns:
        true if the value was removed

      • removeStatisticValues

        boolean removeStatisticValues(Statistic<? extends StatisticValue<?>> statistic)
        Removes all values associated with the given statistic. If the statistic uses a binning strategy, all bins will be removed.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to remove values for
        Returns:
        true if values were removed

      • removeTypeSpecificStatisticValues

        boolean removeTypeSpecificStatisticValues(IndexStatistic<? extends StatisticValue<?>> statistic,
                                          String typeName)
        Remove all type-specific values from the given index statistic. If the statistic does not use a DataTypeBinningStrategy, nothing will be removed.
        Parameters:
        statistic -
        typeName -
        Returns:

      • createStatisticValueWriter

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> StatisticValueWriter<V> createStatisticValueWriter(Statistic<V> statistic)
        Creates a writer that can be used to write values for a given statistic.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to write values for
        Returns:
        a new statistic value writer

      • createUpdateCallback

        <T> StatisticUpdateCallback<T> createUpdateCallback(Index index,
                                                    AdapterToIndexMapping indexMapping,
                                                    InternalDataAdapter<T> type,
                                                    boolean updateAdapterStats)
        Creates a callback that can be used to update statistics for the given index and adapter.
        Parameters:
        index - the index
        type - the data type
        updateAdapterStats - if true adapter statistics will be updated, otherwise only index statistics will be updated
        Returns:
        a statistics update callback

      • getStatisticValues

        CloseableIterator<? extends StatisticValue<?>> getStatisticValues(Iterator<? extends Statistic<? extends StatisticValue<?>>> statistics,
                                                                  @Nullable
                                                                  BinConstraints.ByteArrayConstraints binConstraints,
                                                                  String... authorizations)
        Returns all values for each provided statistic. If a set of bins are provided, statistics that use a binning strategy will only return values that match one of the given bins.
        Parameters:
        statistics - the statistics to get values for
        binConstraints - an optional bins filter
        authorizations - authorizations for the query
        Returns:
        an iterator for all matching statistic values

      • getStatisticValue

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> V getStatisticValue(Statistic<V> statistic,
                                                    String... authorizations)
        Return the value of the given statistic. This method is not applicable to statistics that use a binning strategy.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to get the value of
        authorizations - authorizations for the query
        Returns:
        the value of the statistic, or null if it was not found

      • getStatisticValue

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> V getStatisticValue(Statistic<V> statistic,
                                                    ByteArray bin,
                                                    String... authorizations)
        Return the value of the given statistic. This method is not applicable to statistics that do not use a binning strategy.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to get the value of
        bin - the bin of the value to get
        authorizations - authorizations for the query
        Returns:
        the value of the statistic, or null if it was not found

      • getStatisticValues

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> CloseableIterator<V> getStatisticValues(Statistic<V> statistic,
                                                                        ByteArrayRange[] binRanges,
                                                                        String... authorizations)
        Return the values of the given statistic that have bins that match the given ranges. This method is not applicable to statistics that do not use a binning strategy.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to get the value of
        binRanges - the ranges of bins to get values for
        authorizations - authorizations for the query
        Returns:
        the value of the statistic, or null if it was not found

      • getStatisticValues

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> CloseableIterator<V> getStatisticValues(Statistic<V> statistic,
                                                                        ByteArray binPrefix,
                                                                        String... authorizations)
        Return the values of the given statistic that have bins that start with the given prefix. This method is not applicable to statistics that do not use a binning strategy.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to get the value of
        binPrefix - the bin prefix to get values for
        authorizations - authorizations for the query
        Returns:
        the matching values of the statistic

      • getStatisticValues

        <V extends StatisticValue<R>,R> CloseableIterator<V> getStatisticValues(Statistic<V> statistic,
                                                                        String... authorizations)
        Returns all of the values for a given statistic. If the statistic uses a binning strategy, each bin will be returned as a separate value.
        Parameters:
        statistic - the statistic to get values for
        authorizations - authorizations for the query
        Returns:
        the values for the statistic

      • mergeStats

        boolean mergeStats()
        Merges all statistic values that share the same key. Every separate write to a data type can create new values for a statistic. Over time, this can result in a lot of values for a single statistic. This function can be used to merge those values to improve statistic query performance.
        Returns:
        true if the merge was successful

      • removeAll

        void removeAll()
        Remove all statistics from the data store.
